intro: Rottlera rufidula, commonly known as the red-stemmed rottlera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and southern Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a rough, textured surface, while its stems are woody and often reddish in color. Rottlera rufidula is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
